original_title: Sri Lanka local polls: finance ministry will honour court order, says state minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s finance ministry will honour a recent Supreme Court order that directed the ministry secretary and the Attorney General not to withhold funds allocated for local government elections, State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said.
Siyambalapitiya told reporters on Saturday March 04 that everyone is obligated to respect the decision of the courts.
“As the finance ministry, we too will honour that verdict and act accordingly. I see no issue with that,” he said.
The ministry will have to direct the funds accordingly, he added.

The Supreme Court issued an interim order on Friday preventing the Finance Ministry Secretary and the Attorney General from withholding funds allocated for the now-postponed local government elections.
The apex court issued the verdict after taking up a petition filed by main opposition Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) general secretary and MP Ranjith Madduma Bandara.
